mph.connection

Class ProfessorManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • mph.connection.ProfessorManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArtifactEvaluatorFunctionalities, ArtifactViewerFunctionalities, BasicUserManagerInterface, CourseViewerFunctionalities, DeliverableViewerFunctionalities, ProfessorManagerRemote, ProjectEditingFunctionalities, ProjectViewerFunctionalities, TeamViewerFunctionalities, UserEditingFunctionalities, UserLoginFunctionalities, UserSessionInterface, UserViewerFunctionalities

    public class ProfessorManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProfessorManagerRemote
    This singleton class initializes the local interface of the Professor and contains the methods of that interface, which are implemented by the Server.
    It implements ProfessorManagerRemote.

      • lookup

        private void lookup()
             throws javax.naming.NamingException
        It invokes ConnectionManager.setConnection() to try to set up a connection with the Server.
        Initialize the local professor interface using Context.lookup(String)
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException - if a connection error occurs during the lookup of the Server

      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String theUsername,
         java.lang.String thePassword)
           throws InvalidArgumentException,
                  AlreadyLoggedInException,
                  UserDoesNotExistException,
                  PasswordMismatchException,
                  javax.naming.NamingException
        Log in a professor.
        It invokes lookup() to execute a lookup of the Server.
        It Invokes UserLoginFunctionalities.login(String, PasswordHashDTO).
        Parameters:
        theUsername - of the professor
        thePassword - inserted by the professor
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if a given argument is not valid
        AlreadyLoggedInException - if the professor is already logged in
        UserDoesNotExistException - if the username given as parameter does not exist
        PasswordMismatchException - if the password given as parameter does not match with the one stored in the database
        javax.naming.NamingException - if a connection error occurs

      • login

        public void login(java.lang.String theUsername,
         PasswordHashDTO thePasswordHash)
           throws InvalidArgumentException,
                  AlreadyLoggedInException,
                  UserDoesNotExistException,
                  PasswordMismatchException
        Description copied from interface: UserLoginFunctionalities
        Log into the MPH system the user identified by the username given as parameter
        Specified by:
        login in interface UserLoginFunctionalities
        Parameters:
        theUsername - the username
        thePasswordHash - the hash of the user password
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if one of the arguments is not valid
        UserDoesNotExistException - if the username given as parameter is not registered into the system
        PasswordMismatchException - if the hash given as parameter does not match with the one saved into the database
        AlreadyLoggedInException

      • publishNewProject

        public ProjectIdDTO publishNewProject(CourseIdDTO theCourseId,
                             java.lang.String theProjectName,
                             java.util.Date theStartDate,
                             java.util.Date theEndDate,
                             java.lang.String theDescription,
                             java.util.Set<DeliverableDTO> aDeliverableSet)
                               throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                      UserNotLoggedInException,
                                      ProjectNameAlreadyExists,
                                      DateInconsistencyException,
                                      DeliverableNameAlreadyExists,
                                      ForbiddenOperationException
        Publish a new project.
        It invokes registerNewProject(CourseIdDTO, String, Date, Date, String, Set)
        Parameters:
        theCourseId - of the course which the project refers to
        theProjectName - the name of the new project
        theStartDate - of the project
        theEndDate - of the project
        theDescription - of the new project
        aDeliverableSet - a set of deliverables
        Returns:
        the newly published project id
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if a given argument is not valid
        UserNotLoggedInException - if the professor is not logged in
        ProjectNameAlreadyExists - if the name chosen for the project already exists
        DateInconsistencyException - if there is inconsistency with the given dates
        DeliverableNameAlreadyExists - if the given set of deliverables contains deliverable names which exist already
        ForbiddenOperationException - if the professor is not allowed to execute this operation

      • registerNewProject

        public ProjectIdDTO registerNewProject(CourseIdDTO theCourseId,
                              java.lang.String theProjectName,
                              java.sql.Date theStartDate,
                              java.sql.Date theEndDate,
                              java.lang.String theDescription,
                              java.util.Set<DeliverableDTO> aDeliverableSet)
                                throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                       UserNotLoggedInException,
                                       ProjectNameAlreadyExists,
                                       DateInconsistencyException,
                                       DeliverableNameAlreadyExists,
                                       ForbiddenOperationException
        Description copied from interface: ProjectEditingFunctionalities
        Register a new project with the given arguments into the MPH system
        Specified by:
        registerNewProject in interface ProjectEditingFunctionalities
        Parameters:
        theCourseId - the id of the course which contains the project to be published
        theProjectName - the name of the project to be published
        theStartDate - the start date of the project to be published
        theEndDate - the end date of the project to be published
        theDescription - the description of the project to be published
        aDeliverableSet - the set of deliverables composing the project to be published
        Returns:
        the id of the newly registered project
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - if one of the arguments is not valid
        UserNotLoggedInException - if the user is not logged in
        ProjectNameAlreadyExists - if the project name given as parameter is already in use
        DateInconsistencyException - if the dates given as parameters are not consistent
        DeliverableNameAlreadyExists - if the set of deliverables contains duplicated names
        ForbiddenOperationException - if the user is not allowed to execute the operation
